IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO SUPPORT THE HEALTH CARE ACTIVITIES OF 501(C)(3) ORGANIZATIONS IN OUR COMMUNITY.
IRS990.MissionDesc: TO SUPPORT THE HEALTH CARE ACTIVITIES OF 501(C)(3) ORGANIZATIONS IN OUR COMMUNITY.
IRS990.Desc: ST LUKE'S LUTHERAN HEALTH MINISTRIES PROVIDES SUPPORT TO NONPROFIT HEALTH CARE RELATED MINISTRIES THAT BENEFIT THE SAN ANTONIO REGIONAL COMMUNITY, WITH PRIMARY CONSIDERATION GIVEN IN THIS ORDER OF PRIORITY (1) DIRECT AND INDIRECT HEALTH CARE SERVICES (MEDICAL, DENTAL, MENTAL HEALTH CARE AND PROTECTIVE HEALTH SERVICES), (2) HEALTH EDUCATION, PREVENTATIVE SERVICES AND WELLNESS INITIATIVES AND (3) HEALTH CARE EQUIPMENT AND SUPPLIES THAT ARE CRITICAL TO THE DELIVERY OF DIRECT CARE. 47 ORGANIZATIONS RECEIVED GRANTS TO FURTHER THEIR MISSIONS DURING FISCAL YEAR 2023.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE D, PAGE 4, PART XI, LINE 4B
SCHEDULE D, PAGE 4, PART XII, LINE 4B

RecipientBusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: SAN ANTONIO LIGHTHOUSE FOR THE BLIN

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: RECIPIENTS COMPLETE REPORTS IN CONJUNCTION WITH SPENDING THE GRANT MONEY. A REPORT IS DUE SIX MONTHS AFTER RECEIVING THE FUNDS AND EVERY SIX MONTHS THEREAFTER, UNTIL THE FUNDS ARE SPENT. AT THE TIME ALL FUNDS ARE SPENT, A FINAL REPORT IS REQUIRED. IF AN ORGANIZATION SPENDS ALL OF THE GRANT MONEY WITHIN THE FIRST SIX MONTHS. THEN ONLY A FINAL REPORT IS REQUIRED. IF THE REPORTS ARE NOT RECEIVED, THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR NOTIFIES THE ORGANIZATION TO COMPLETE THE MISSING REPORTS. ALL REPORTS ARE REVIEWED BY THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR AND UNEXPECTED OUTCOMES ARE REPORTED TO THE GRANT COMMITTEE.
ALTHOUGH THERE ARE SEVERAL COMMITTEES OF THE BOARD, NO COMMITTEE CAN ACT WITHOUT APPROVAL OF THE FULL BOARD.
THE FORM 990 IS REVIEWED BY THE AUDIT COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS. THE REVIEW IS PERFORMED IN CONJUNCTION WITH THE REVIEW OF THE ANNUAL AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS.

AN ANNUAL DISCLOSURE STATEMENT IS CIRCULATED TO ALL PERSONS TO WHOM THE POLICY APPLIES TO ASSIST THEM IN CONSIDERING SUCH DISCLOSURES. HOWEVER, DISCLOSURE IS APPROPRIATE WHENEVER CONFLICTS ARISE. THE WRITTEN NOTICES OF CONFLICTS ARE FILED WITH THE PRESIDENT OF THE ORGANIZATION OR A PERSON DESIGNATED FROM TIME TO TIME TO RECEIVE SUCH NOTIFICATIONS. ALL DISCLOSURE NOTICES RECEIVED ARE RECORDED IN THE MINUTES OF A MEETING OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS. ANY MEMBER DISCLOSING A CONFLICT MUST REMOVE THEMSELVES FROM THE DISCUSSION AND ABSTAIN FROM VOTING AND THIS ACTION IS DOCUMENTED IN THE MINUTES.

THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE MEETS ANNUALLY TO REVIEW THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR'S PERFORMANCE AND REVIEW DOCUMENTATION OF ACCOMPLISHMENTS SUBMITTED TO THE COMMITTEE BY THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR. BASED UPON DISCUSSIONS AND THE REVIEW OF THE DOCUMENTATION, THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE MAKES RECOMMENDATIONS REGARDING CONTINUED EMPLOYMENT AND COMPENSATION.
DOCUMENTS ARE MADE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST FROM THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR OR A BOARD MEMBER.
